translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about the Giver of a Support

analyzed: a byādhikattheḥ a padāna  vipassissa bhagavataḥ
translated: The Story of the Elder Abyādhika🔽“I gave a fire-hall
to the Fortunate One Vipassī,
and a dwelling for the sick,
and I accepted hot water.
Because of that deed of mine,
this my bodily existence is well-formed;
I do not know of any sickness,
this is the fruit of that meritorious deed.
For ninety-one eons
the thatch I gave then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the fire-hall.
And in the seventh succession from that,
I was the undefeated Aparājita,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Abyādhika recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā abyādhiko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Abyādhikattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai abyādhikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽abyādhika therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Story of the Elder Abyādhika is the fifth.
